Explanations about Options.--set-ptr-feedback(M):
device threshold num denom
 Change the pointer acceleration (or feedback) parameters of device. The xset(1)
 man page has more details. For X.Org Server 1.7 and above, there are additional
 device properties pertaining to pointer acceleration. These do not replace, but
 complement the pointer feedback setting.

Explanations about Options.-l(M):
turns login mode on or off (for /run/utmp updating). This can also be defined
 through the "deflogin" .screenrc command.
Explanations about Options.-s(M):
sets the default shell to the program specified, instead of the value in the
 environment variable $SHELL (or "/bin/sh" if not defined). This can also be defined
 through the "shell" .screenrc command. See also there.

Answers.MP Summary: screen manager with VT100/ANSI terminal emulation
Top-3 Scripts:
au_257915: The MinSpeed, MaxSpeed and AccelFactor parameters control  the  pointer
       motion  speed.   The  speed  value defines the scaling between touchpad
       coordinates and  screen  coordinates.   When  moving  the  finger  very
       slowly,  the MinSpeed value is used, when moving very fast the MaxSpeed
       value is used.  When moving the finger at moderate  speed,  you  get  a
       pointer  motion  speed somewhere between MinSpeed and MaxSpeed.  If you
       don't want any acceleration, set MinSpeed  and  MaxSpeed  to  the  same
       value.
